page.title: 04Wittersham Court Farm
page.content: Mr. Frith moved to this farm in 1970 and he has mostly modern buildings with one long, old building. He has about 511 acres 160 of these being reclaimed marshland which makes very good soil for growing crops. He has 6 tractors, 3 trailers and 2 fertilizer spreaders. His 3 daughters have a calf each. There is a{Chitting Shed}which Mr. Frith uses for chitting; the seed potatoes are kept in here in trays, (the chits are the shoots on the sprouting potatoes). Mrs. Frith keeps 150 Kent_Sussex cross ewes and 1 Suffolk and 3 Dorset rams. She has 203 lambs this year. Mr. Frith has a barn in the shape of a referee's whistle in which he keeps hay and when the ewes are in lamb they go in the whistle shed. Mr. Frith grows cereal crops, oil seed rape and potatoes.
